title: Juanita's Cajun Doughnuts
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
8 Cups White Flour (not self-rising)
2 Cups Sugar
1 Cup Evaporated Milk
1 Tablespoon Vanilla (pure vanilla)
6 teaspoons baking Powder
4 Eggs
instructions:
Cream Eggs & Sugar

Add Milk & Vanilla and stir well

Mix Flour and Baking Powder together

Add Flour mixture to liquid mixture

Stir until if forms a gummy ball

Prepare board by powdering with flour

Roll the dough to about 1/4 inch thickness

Cut into squares of about 3 inches

Cut the 3 inch squares diagonally. This will make
little triangles of about 3x3 inches which are easy to
flip over when cooking.

Deep Fat Fry until Golden Brown

Recipe makes several dozen. One way to handle excess
dough: line a cookie sheet with wax paper, layer triangles
80 they do not touch, cover this layer with another sheet of
wax paper and repeat the procedure. In quantities that meet
your needs, put in zip lock bags. Defrost about 10 minutes
before dropping into hot oil.
misc:
Juanita says, "I use Martha White all purpose flour, Canola cooking oil
and Clabber Girl baking powder. These doughnuts should
not absorb oil. If they do, try increasing the heat of your
cooking oil."

title: Susan's Bread Pudding
author: Susan Saunders of Point Blue
ingredients:
9 Slices of Bread (broken into pieces)
4 Cups Whole Milk (warmed)
2 Eggs (beaten)
1-1/2 Cups Sugar
1/2 Bar of Butter or margarine 8 oz. (melted)
1 Can Sweetened Condensed Milk 14 oz.
1 Tablespoon Vanilla Extract
instructions:
Mix Sugar, Eggs, Butter, Vanilla and Condensed Milk in a large bowl.

Beat ingredients until well blended (about 2 minutes with wire whisk).

Then Stir in warm Milk.

Place broken up pieces of bread in 11 x 14 pan.

Pre-heat oven to 300 degrees and Bake for 45 minutes.
misc:
If you cut recipe in half, the cooking time is 30 minutes,
and the pudding should be baked in an 8-1/2 inch square pan.

Susan says "I sometimes use French bread for a crunchier texture,
I use about half a loaf."

It tastes best if served warm or at room temperature.

Susan owns "Susan's on Court" in Ville Platte. 
She got the recipe from her mother, Mrs. Vial Manuel, who received 
the recipe from her mother, Mrs. Odin Ardoin of Tate Cove.

title: Bea's Bread Pudding
author: Bea Fontenot of Mamou
ingredients:
1 Can Evaporated Milk (12 02.)
2 Cups Milk
4 Egg Yokes
1/3 Cup Melted Butter
1 Cup Sugar
1 teaspoon Nutmeg
1 teaspoon Vanilla
10 Slices of Bread (cubed)
instructions:
Beat Egg Yolks.

Add Milk, Sugar, and melted butter into egg yolks
and stir until well mixed. (if you like raisins--add now).

Fold Bread into mixture and let bread soak for about 1 minute.

Pour into baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

**Making the Meringue**

Use 4 Egg Whites. Add 1/4 teaspoon Cream of
Tartar and beat until stiff, then

Add Sugar 1 Tablespoon at a time while beating egg
Whites (8 Tablespoons Sugar). Continue beating until
stiff peaks form.

Spread Meringue on hot pudding and retum to oven
until Meringue is brown.

title: Juanita's Oatmeal Cookies
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1 pack yellow Cake Mix
2 Cups of Oatmeal (uncooked)
1 Cup Sugar
1 Cup Cooking Oil (veg.)
2 Large Eggs
1 Cup of Pecans (chopped)
1-1/2 teaspoons Vanilla
instructions:
Mix Cake Mix, Oatmeal and Sugar (stir well).

In another dish, Combine Oil, Vanilla, and Eggs
and stir well. then

Combine both mixtures and stir well, then

Add Pecans and Stir Well again.

Drop by Spoonful on a cookie sheet.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees. Bake 12 minutes.

title: Juanita's Sugar Cookies
author: Juanita Ardoin of Mamou
ingredients:
2-1/2 Cups Flour
1 Cup Sugar
3/4 Cup Cooking Oil (we use Canola)
2 Eggs
3 teaspoons Baking Powder
1 teaspoon Vanilla
instructions:
Mix Sugar, Oil, Eggs, and Vanilla Flavor

Then Add Flour and Baking Powder and mix until well blended in.

Use a teaspoon to form Balls about 1-1/2 inches across (about size of ping-pong ball.)

Put about 1/2 cup of Sugar in a dish and roll the dough balls in the sugar.

Then put balls on a cookie sheet, flattening them as you go. Leave them about 1/4 inch in thickness

title: Juanita's Peanut Butter Cookies
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
2-1/2 Cups Flour
1 Cup Butter
1 Cup Peanut Butter
1 Cup White Sugar
1 Cup Brown Sugar
1/2 teaspoon Soda
1/2 teaspoon Salt
2 Eggs
instructions:
Mix flour, salt, baking soda, and set aside

Mix Butter and Peanut Butter and ADD both kinds of Sugar and Mix Well

Add Eggs and Beat Well

Stir "Flour Mixture" into "Butter Mix"

Drop Dough unto buttered pan and flatten dough with fork

Pre-heat oven and Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes

title: Mama's Cajun French Toast
author: My Mama--Lestea S. Ardoin--wife of Kimbell Ardoin. They owned a grocery store, gas plant, and post plant.
ingredients:
1 Egg
3/4 Cup Sugar [I think he's talking about powdered sugar since that's how I always ate it at his house]
5 ounces Evaporated Milk
1 teaspoon Vanilla
2 Tablespoons Cooking Oil
instructions:
Mix and Whip up all ingredients [except for the cooking oil].

Put 2 Tablespoons of Cooking Oil in a skillet and heat until it starts to smoke--like you do when you want to fry eggs.

Drop slice of bread in mixture and let it soak for about 2 seconds, then flip it over to other side and soak for another 2 seconds.

Immediately drop slice of bread into hot skillet and cook until it starts to blacken--but only slightly. Do both sides.

Put on your plate and sprinkle liberally with Sugar. Tastes Great with a glass of Milk.
misc:
I add enough Sugar to cover all the dark places.
Every time I eat this, I think of my mother'sgenerosity--allowing me to use so much sugar.
As a kid we were in the Great Depression--in my later years, sugar was rationed--during World War II.

title: JAKE'S Peanut Butter Ball Cookies
author: JAKE ARDOIN of Eunice--a son of Dr. Brent C. Ardoin
ingredients:
Honey
Cereal -- any kind (crunch it)
Peanut Butter (as much as needed)
1 zip-lock bag to crunch cereal
1 glass to crunch the cereal with—-or the palm of your hand. You could even use a rolling pin.
instructions:
Put 6 handfuls of cereal in zip-lock bag.

Crunch it real fine.

Put Cereal in a dish and Add Honey (as muchas needed to hold it together)and mix real well.

Take Peanut Butter and form into balls. About this size...[in the book there's a circle here about the size of the one you'd get if you put the tip of your pointer finger to the middle knuckle of your thumb]

Roll Peanut Butter Balls in Honey and Cereal Mixture.

Let set about 3 to 30 minutes in refrigerator.

Then you eat them all. One ball at a time please.

Jake thinks 3 minutes is plenty long enough to wait. He says 30 minutes is OK for Old people.
misc:
Jake, 8 years old, is one of my grandsons. While he watched tapes on TV, I'd slip over to the office to type.

After the third trip, he asked, "Pa-pa, why do you sneak off and come hide in the office?"

I explained that I was writing a cookbook.

He said, "Hey, I got a recipe!" 

Voila—his recipe got into the cookbook.

He also performed the "hemlock" maneuver on me when I was down on my knees trying to cough my life away. For this I thought he deserved having his picture in the book.

[Note from Jake: At some point after I add the recipes I'll be adding all pages containing pictures and non-recipe discussions to it's own section. So go there if you want to see it.]

title: Juanita's Strawberry Bunt Cake
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
**Cake Ingredients**
1 box Cake mix--white or yellow. I use Duncan Hines
1 box Strawberry Gelatin (regular size)
10 oz. Frozen Strawberries (thawed)
1/4 Cup Cold Water
3/4 Cup high grade Oil (I use Canola)
4 whole Eggs

**Glaze Ingredients**
1/2 stick of Butter (1/4 lb.)
1 Cup Powdered Sugar
10 oz. Frozen Strawberries (thawed)
instructions:
**Cake Instructions**
Mix the Cake mix, dry Gelatin, water and Oil together.

Beat in the eggs -- One at a time until well mixed. Beat according to directions on cake mix box (not all cake mixes are the same).

Fold in Strawberries.

Transfer to Bunt Cake Pan.

Pre-heat oven & bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour

**Glaze Instructions**
Put Sugar and Butter in a sauce pan and cook until Sugar is melted.

Pour in Strawberries and Mix.

Remove Cake from Bunt to Serving Plate.

While Cake is still warm, Pour Glaze on a little at a time.

title: Matha's Fresh Pear Cake
author: Martha Fuselier
ingredients:
3 Cups Flour
1 teaspoon Soda
1 teaspoon Salt
2 Cups Sugar
1-1/2 Cups Cooking Oil
3 Eggs
Dice 3 Pears (or substitute 3 Apples)
1 Cup Coconut
1 Cup Pecans (pieces)
1 teaspoon Vanilla
Butterscotch Chips
instructions:
Mix 3 Cups Flour, teaspoon Soda, and teaspoon Salt
and Mix Well. Then

Cream 2 Cups Sugar with 1-1/2 Cups Cooking
Oil, 3 Eggs and teaspoon Vanilla -- Then Add
to Above Mixture

‘Add diced Pears (or Apples), Cup of Coconut,
Cup of Pecans.

Pour into tube Pan and cover cake with
Butterscotch Chips

Pre-heat oven to 325 degrees and cook at 325
degrees for 1-1/2 hours

title: Goldie's Black Eye Pea Cake
author: Goldie Jemerson -- one of her mother's recipes
ingredients:
Cake Ingredients:
1 Cup Wesson Cooking Oil
1 Cup Buttermilk
2 Cups Flour
2 Cups Sugar
2 Cups (drained) Black Eye Peas (smashed)
3 Whole Eggs
1 teaspoon Soda
1 teaspoon Salt
1 teaspoon Almond Extract

Glaze Ingredients:
1 Cup Powdered Sugar
3 Tablespoons of Milk
1 teaspoon Vanilla
instructions:
To make Cake:
Mix all ingredients in one bowl
Beat all ingredients together
Pout into bunt pan

To Make Glaze:
Mix all ingredients
Apply to Cake while Cake is Warm

title: Stephanie's Old Fasioned Syrup Cake
author: Stephanie Dupre of Ville Platte, now living in Mamou
ingredients:
1/2 Cup Buttermilk
1/2 Cup Sugar
1/2 Cup Butter or Margarine
2 Cups Cane Syrup
2 Cups Self-Rising Flour
2 teaspoons Vanilla
1 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Soda
2 Eggs
instructions:
Mix Sugar, Syrup, Butter. -- Mix thoroughly.
 
Add Eggs and mix well.

‘Add Salt, Soda, Vanilla, Buttermilk and mix
well until blended with other ingredients.

Add Flour. Stir while adding flour little by litte
to avoid lumping.

Pour into cooking pan (9 x 13), or in a bunt
pan--sometimes called a tube pan.

Pre-heat Oven to 350 degrees and cook at 350
degrees for 45 minutes.

title: CJ's Pineapple Meringue Cake
author: Claudia--C.J. is married to Terry Fontenot of Lafayette
ingredients:
Ingredients for Cake:
1 Cup Flour
2 teaspoons Baking Powder
2 teaspoons Vanilla
5 Tablespoons of Milk
4 Eggs (separate yolk from white)
1-1/2 Cups Sugar
1/2 Cup Vegetable Shortening
3/4 Cup Finely chopped Pecans

Ingredients for Filling:
1 small can crushed pineapple (8 oz.)
8 oz. Cool Whip
1/2 Cup Powdered Sugar
instructions:
Instructions for Cake:
Grease and Flour Two 9" round cake pans

Sift Flour and Baking Powder onto wax paper

Beat Egg Whites until foamy; then beat in 1 Cup
Sugar until stiff (meringue forms peaks); then
add 1 teaspoon Vanilla

Beat Shortening and 1/2 Cup Sugar until smooth;
then beat in Egg Yolks

Beat in Flour alternately with Milk

Stir in 1 teaspoon Vanilla

Put Batter into 2 pans; top with half of the
meringue on each,

Top with Pecans

Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes and let cool.

Instructions for making Pineapple Cream Filling:
Drain pineapple -- press dry with paper towels
Add powdered sugar and cool whip and Mix Well.

Instructions for putting Cake together
Place 1 layer Meringue side down on a plate.
Spread Creme Filling on top, and then
Top with 2nd layer -- Meringue side up

title: Lucille's 1, 2,3, 4 Cake
author: Lucille Deville of Mamou
ingredients:
[Cake Ingredients]
1 Cup Butter
2 Cups Sugar
3 Cups Flour
4 teaspoons Baking Powder
1 Cup Milk
4 Eggs
1-1/2 teaspoons flavor (match flavor of filling)
1/3 Cup Crisco Cooking Oil

[Frosting Ingredients]
1/2 Cup Water
1 pound Powdered Sugar
2/3 Cup of Crisco Shortening
1/16 teaspoon Salt (dash of Salt)
instructions:
[Cake Instructions]
Blend Sugar with Butter and Eggs. Add one eggat a time while mixing. Then Add Milk and flavor of your choice and Mix Well.... then

Mix Flour with Baking Powder and then mix this into the mixture. Mixing small portions of flour at a time until it is all mixed in.

This should make 3 layers, using 9" pie pans. Bake for 33 minutes at 350 degrees, or, until when you stick toothpick in--it comes out clean.

[Frosting Instructions]
Whip or beat All ingredients together. and

Spread onto Cake.

title: Verdie's Fig Cake--Loaf
author: Ms. Verdie from Eunice is married to Rev. Gabriel Carrier.
ingredients:
1 Pint Cooked Figs with syrup
1/2 Cup Butter
2 Tablespoons Sugar
2 Eggs
1 Cup plus 3 Tablespoons Flour
1/2 teaspoon Soda
1 teaspoon Baking Powder
instructions:
We used 9x13 dish to cook. 9x15 may be better.
Cream butter, sugar, eggs.
Mash figs well and add to mixture.
Mix flour, soda, and baking powder and add to mixture.
Pour flour into mixture and mix well. (we used a food processor to mix--works well.)
Pre-heat oven and Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes
The original recipe calls for using less than all the syrup in the figs and recommended cooking for 20 minutes.
misc: This goes real well with coffee and company; it's not toosweet--just right

title: Edwina's Red Velvet Cake
author: Edwina Chapman
ingredients:
[Cake Ingredients]
1 Cup Butter
1-1/2 Cup Sugar
2 Eggs
2-1/2 Cup Flour
1 Cup Buttermilk
1 teaspoon Vanilla
1 teaspoon Butter Flavor
2 Tablespoons Chocolate
2 oz. Red Food Coloring
1 teaspoon + 1 teaspoon Vinegar, Mix with 1 teaspoon Baking Powder 
(Jake: I think this means 1tsp vinegar mixed with 1tsp baking soda. Soda is mentioned in the instructions and powder is not, and baking powder wouldn't need the vinegar)

[Frosting Ingredients]
1 Cup Milk
3 Tablespoons flour
1 Cup Butter
1 Cup Sugar
1 teaspoon Vanilla
1 teaspoon Butter Flavor
instructions:
[Cake Instructions]
Cream butter and sugar
Add Eggs, beaten in
Add Vanilla and Butter flavor
Add Coco and food coloring and mix well
Add flour & buttermilk...mix a little at a time
Add soda and vinegar
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees
Bake for 30 minutes (makes 3 layers)

[Frosting Instructions]
Cook milk and flour until thick and set aside to cool.
While it cools you may do the following:
Mix butter and sugar. Beat until light and fluffy.
Then Add vanilla and butter flavor.
Blend with white sugar until it looks like honey.
Mix with milk and flour mixture...mix well
Let cook and cool... then frost.

title: Bernadette's Syrup Pies
author: Bemadette Bertrand 87 years old and lives in Mamou, La.
ingredients:
[Pie Crust Ingredients]
1-1/2 Cup Sugar
3 Egg Yolk (she docs not use egg whites)
2 Cup Crisco
1 Cup Water
Add 2 teaspoons Vanilla or 1/2 teaspoon Nutmeg
3 teaspoons Baking Powder
5 Cups Flour

[Pie Filling Ingredients]
2 Cups Cane Syrup
1/2 Cup Flour
1 Cup Water (from tap)
instructions:
[Pie Crust Instructions]
Cream egg yolks, sugar, Crisco
Add water and flavor
Mix in flour and Baking Powder.
Take ball of dough--size of tennis ball and pat in pan
Put filling and cut strips of dough to weave to make top pie crust.

[Pie Filling Instructions]
Put 2 Cups cane syrup into 6 cup sauce pan.
Mix flour and water until there are no lumps....then
Mix in Syrup & cook until it's as thick as a pudding
Let cool-put into pie crust & weave top crust
Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes.
misc:
There's no need to re-invent the wheel--She's got it down pat.
[Jake's note: This filing is what my MawMaw Juanita Ardoin (author of other recipes in this collection) uses for her syrup pies, but she uses a different pie crust.
I'll post that pie crust recipe somewhere under 'Della and Juanita's Sweet Pie Dough']

title: Minerva's Fluffy Pineapple Pie
author: Minerva Baker
ingredients:
2 Tablespoons Sugar
3 Tablespoons Flour
1/8 teaspoon of Salt
14 oz. can of Crushed Pineapple
2/3 Cup Syrup from Crushed Pineapple
1 Egg (well beaten)
16 Marshmallows (large) quartered
1/2 Cup of heavy Cream (whipped) |Substitute: evaporated milk. See miscellaneous section.|
24 Vanilla Wafers
instructions:
Mix Sugar, Flour, and Salt
Add pineapple syrup and blend all these ingredients
Cook over low heat until thick (stir constantly)
Add a little of the hot mixture to the egg then stir this into the mixture in pot. |Jake: This wasn't immediatly clear to me, but it means to temper the egg by adding a little of the hot mixture from pot to the egg, then add the egg to the pot.|
Continue cooking until thick ... then
Add Marshmallows and stir until they melt.
Add Pineapple and Chill 1 hour
Line bottom of 8" pie pan with 12 crushed Vanilla wafers and stand another 12 whole Vanilla wafers around edge of pie pan.
Now fold in whipped cream and pour into pie pan
Chill another 30 minutes before serving.
misc:
She calls it "Cajun" California Style.
If you don't have Heavy Cream, substitute 1/2 cup of Evaporated Milk.
Put can of milk in freezer for about 30 minutes before whipping. This improves consistency and will work just fine.

title: Verline's Sweet Dough Pie Crust
author: Verline Fontenot
ingredients:
2 Eggs
4 Cups of Flour
1 Cup Sugar
1/2 Cup of Butter
4 Tablespoons of Milk
2 teaspoons of Vanilla Flavor
4 teaspoons of Baking Powder
instructions:
Cream Eggs and Sugar
Add Butter
Add Milk and Vanilla
Mix Flour and Baking Powder
Add to egg mixture and continue to stir until dough is all of uniform consistency
Cut dough into four (4) Balls and
Roll out the dough and put in pie plates.

title: Corina's Old Fashioned Sweet Dough
author: Corina Granger of Mamou
ingredients:
1 Cup Crisco (shortening)
3 Eggs
1 Cup Sugar
1 Cup Milk
5 Cups Flour
5 teaspoons Baking Powder
1/2 teaspoon Vanilla (If imitation Vanilla is used, use 1 teaspoon.)
instructions:
Cream or Mix Shortening, Eggs, Milk, and Sugar in a large bowl.
Mix 1 Cup Flour and 1 teaspoon of Baking Powder at a time and add that to the mixture while stirring.
Mix another Cup Flour and 1 teaspoon Baking Powder (repeat above process until all flour is mixed with the ingredients.)
You may use a mixer until the mixture becomes thick, then use spoon to continue mixing. The reason for this is that you may burn the mixer.
Roll out dough on a sheet.
serving_size: Should make enough dough for 3 pies--easily

title: Kim's Pecan Pie
author: Kim Manuel--a School Teacher
ingredients:
3 Jumbo Eggs
2/3 Cup Sugar
1/3 Cup melted Butter or margarine
1 Cup light Corn Syrup
1-1/2 Cups Pecan Halves or broken pecans
1/2 teaspoon Salt
1 Tablespoon Pure Cane Syrup (Steen's)
1 Pie Shell (9 or 10")
instructions:
Beat Eggs and Sugar, then
Add melted Butter, Salt, and Syrup.....then
Add and stir in Pecans
Pour into Shell
Pre-Heat oven to 375°F degrees and Bake at 375°F degrees for 1 hour, or until the filling is set,(whatever that means).
misc:
Yes, 1 make my own pie dough; but the recipe for the dough is as long as this recipe; therefore, I recommended a pie shell for the sake of space.
|Jake: presumably that's a quote from Kim|

title: Ms.Bertha's Pecan Praline
author: Ms. Bertha Deshotel
ingredients:
1 Small Pet Milk (4 oz. can)
2 Cups Sugar
1/2 Cup Marshmallow
1/4 pound Butter
1 Tablespoon Chocolate
2 Cups Pecans
instructions:
Mix all ingredients (Except Pecans) Milk, Sugar,Chocolate, Butter, and Marshmallow.
Cook on stove until all melted together.
Add the 2 Cups Pecans and stir until a drop of the liquid forms ball when dropped in cool water.
Put by spoonful on greased pan or waxed paper.

title: Cat's Pecan Pralines
author: Catherine Moullier, married to Littelle Moullier of Mamou
ingredients:
1 Can (14 02.) Condensed Milk
1/4 pound Butter or Margarine
1 Cup Sugar
1 teaspoon Vanilla flavor
3 Cups of Pecans
instructions:
Mix Condensed Milk, Butter, Sugar and Vanilla.
Cook for 12 minutes
Add Pecans and stir well
Drop by spoonful on lightly buttered cookie sheet
misc:
Grandmas didn't get to make candy as often as they would have liked, but, when they did make some, they didn't have to work hard at it.
It's fast and easy--especially for those of us who only eat it. Littelle--what do you think?

title: Donna's Chocolate Peanut Candy
author: Donna Prather of Lafayette
ingredients:
2 1/2 Cups Sugar
1 Cup Evaporated Milk
1 Cup Marshmallow Cream or 16 big marshmallows
2 Tablespoons of Butter
2 Tablespoons of Creamy Peanut Butter
1/4 teaspoon Salt
6 oz. of Chocolate Chips
1 Cup of "Darkly" Roasted Peanuts. Peanuts should be roasted for 10 minutes,, while other ingredients are cooking.
instructions:
Mix ingredients: Sugar, Milk, Butter, Marshmallow, Peanut Butter, and Salt.
Put in pot, bring to a boil and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes--stir constantly. Then
Turn off heat, Add: Chocolate Chips and Roasted Peanuts. Mix Well Then
Pour in a pan. When cool, cut into squares.
misc:
You may use Pecans. Pecans need to be roasted for only about 5 minutes. Peanuts require 10
Mama & Grandma made candy often, but they certainly didn't work hard. There you see, Cajun Cooking is Fast & Easy.

title: Goldie's Pull Candy (Gov. Jimmie Davis 'Pull Candy')
author: Goldie Jemerson
ingredients:
2 Cups of Brown Sugar
1 Cup of Steen's Pure Cane Syrup (or molasses)
1 Cup of Water3 Tablespoons of Butter or margarine
3 Tablespoons Vinegar
instructions:
Mix Syrup, Sugar, Vinegar, and Water. Stir well.
Put in pot and boil until--when you drop a little in a cup of cold water--it's brittle. then
Add Butter and stir it in real well,
Pour it out to cool on a buttered pan or board.
When it has cooled enough to be handled by hand, pull it over and over (stretch it out) until it turns a light brown color. Don't forget to put Butter on your hands all over before you start the pulling. If you don't Butter up properly, the candy will stick to your hands.
When candy is right, you can cut it into short strips with a pair of scissors--knife doesn't work very well.

title: Judy's Fantastic Pecan Fudge
author: Judy McBride-owner of Judy's Cajun Rainbow in Mamou
ingredients:
1 pound of chopped Pecans (or more)
3 Cups Sugar
3/4 Cup Butter
2/3 Cup Pet Milk (Evaporated Milk)
12 ounces of Chocolate Chips
1 Jar (7 0z.) Marshmallow Cream (Vanilla)
instructions:
Put Pet Milk, Butter, and Sugar in a pot and boil for 5 minutes, until it all melts....then
Stir in Chocolate Chips, Marshmallow Cream, and Pecans. Stir until all blended together.
Pour in large square container.
Refrigerate for 3 hours (or until hard)
Cut in squares and it's ready to serve

title: Malou's Mexican Fudge
author: Mrs. Emma Lou Granger Given to us by her daughter, Janice
ingredients:
Use Large Magnalite Pot
6 Cups Sugar
2 Cans Evaporated Milk
1 stick (1/4 1b.) Butter or margarine
2 Cups Pecans
instructions:
Take one cup sugar and brown until almost burnt, then
Add both cans of evaporated milk, 1 stick of butter or margarine, and 5 cups of sugar, then....
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until you can make soft ball in water. then....
Add pecans and bring back to a boil, then....
Take off heat and keep stirring until it turns. (Turns means it will look like it's turning to sugar--a granulated look.) Then....
Pour into large pan and let cool. Then...
Cut into small squares.
misc: This candy is so good it's immoral. You think of hiding it under the bed when you see company coming.

title: Malou's Divinity Candy
author: Emma Lou Granger. Given to us by her daughter, Janice
ingredients:
Use 3 quart Magnalite Pot
1/2 Cup white Karo syrup
1/2 Cup water
2 Cups Sugar
1 teaspoon Vanilla
2 Egg Whites
1 Cup Pecans
instructions:
In pot Add: 1/2 cup Karo, 1/2 cup water, 2 cups sugar, and teaspoon of Vanilla.
Over heat, Stir until Sugar melts, then put on medium heat and let boil until you can drop in water and it forms a hard ball.
While the ingredients above are boiling, Beat 2 egg whites until they form peaks when you stick and withdraw a fork from in them.
When Syrup is ready, pour slowly into egg whites while using a hand mixer to stir in. Then....
Add pecans and mix with spoon until it loses its gloss.
Pour out or spoon out quickly onto wax-paper.
Allow to cool and cut into squares.

title: Ms. Eual's Shoestring Potato Candy
author: Mrs. Eual Young of Mamou
ingredients:
12 ounce pack of Butterscotch Chips
3 Level Tablespoons of Peanut Butter
1 Can (6 0z.) Shoestring potatoes
instructions:
Mix Chips and Peanut Butter in a heavy pot
Cook on low heat
Stir constantly until melted
Take off fire and...
Add shoestring potatoes and mix until well coated.
Drop by spoonful on wax paper.
misc:
Mom & Dad had a grocery store as late as 1953.They had shoestring potatoes in stock in the late 1940s, so I assume Mrs. Young made her recipe at about that time; maybe she even got it off their can.
It can be made in minutes & all our children and grandchildren love it. Juanita has been making it ever since.
[Jake: This shows up every Christmas, and its fantastic.]

title: Coyo's Cajun Breakfast Banyays
author: Lee Roy 'Coyo' Granger
ingredients:
2 Cups Flour
1 teaspoon Salt
1 teaspoon Baking Powder
1-1/2 Cup Milk
2 tablespoons of Cooking Oil for the Skillet.
instructions:
Mix all ingredients real well
Drop by Spoonful in oil in Skillet and cook until Golden Brown.
Then Flip over and do the same to other side.
You can see why we ate pancakes so often. Coyo made those in a jiffy.

title: Edwina's Baking Powder Biscuits
author: Edwina was married to Johnny Chapman
ingredients:
2 Cups Flour
3 teaspoons Baking Powder
1 teaspoon Salt
3/4 Cup Milk
1/4 Cup of Crisco
instructions:
Mix all ingredients together and mix very well.
Bake at 450 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.
misc: Now you know why we ate so many biscuits-lookhow easy they are to make.

title: Shirley's Homemade Bread
author: Shirley Perron of Mamou
ingredients:
2 Cups Milk (scalded)
5 Tablespoons Sugar
2 Tablespoons Salt
2 packages Yeast
2 Cups warm Water
1 Cup Flour
5 Tablespoons melted Shortening
5 Cups Flour (approximately....more flour forkneading)
instructions:
Mix Milk, Sugar and Salt
In separate bowl: Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Add Yeast mixture to Milk mixture. then
Add 1 Cup Flour to make thin mixture.
Cover and let rise to double its size (will foam up)
Stir down & Add melted shortening and stir well. then
Add enough flour to start kneading. Knead well for about 15 minutes. then
Place Dough in greased bowl, Cover and let it rise until it doubles again. then
Turn out unto floured board and knead for about 10 minutes. then
Shape into loaves and place in greased "loaf pans"and allow to rise to double size. then
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

title: Juanita's Cajun Cornbread
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1-1/2 Cups Corn Meal
1/2 Cup Flour
2 teaspoons Baking Powder
1 Tablespoon Oil for mixture
1/2 teaspoon Salt
1 teaspoon Sugar
2 Eggs
1 Tablespoon Oil for Skillet
1 Cup Milk
instructions:
Put Commeal, Flour, Baking Powder, and Salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, Beat Eggs, Milk, and Oil together. Add this to the dry mixture in the other bowl and mix well.
Add oil to a skillet and heat. When good and hot, pour mixture in pot and put in oven.
Preheat Oven. Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes.

title: Lana's Couche-Couche
author: Lana Breaux of Ville Platte
ingredients:
3/4 teaspoon Salt
1/2 Cup Oil
2 Cups Commeal
1 Cup Water
instructions:
Mix Commeal, salt, and water in a bowl. Stir until cornmeal has a damp loose texture, then set aside for 10 minutes to let the cormmeal absorb some water. This will make it more tender.
Use iron pot that covers tightly, heat oil until hot.
Add Cornmeal mixture to pot. Cover pot and lower heat to low heat. (do not stir)
When bottom is starting to brown, stir and cover again.
Continue cooking for about 15 minutes. Stirring about every 3 to 4 minutes until done.
misc: Mrs. Ouida Lafleur got this recipe from her father,Mr. Willie P. Smith. Mrs. Lafleur passed it on to Lana.

title: Nary's 'Couche-Couche A Mom'
author: Nary Reed of Mamou
ingredients:
2 Cups Cornmeal
1 teaspoon Baking Powder
1-1/2 teaspoon Salt
1-1/2 Cup of Milk (or water)
1/2 Cup Shortening
instructions:
Mix commeal, baking powder, salt and milk
Heat shortening in a heavy skillet
Pour mixture into hot shortening
Over High Heat, let a crust form on the bottom
Then Stir well and cover skillet and lower heat to about medium heat. then
Cook for 15 minutes, stir about 3 times during this time.
Serve as a cereal--with milk or with gravy.
misc: We eat it with cane syrup added and crispy friedbacon on the side. Good with fried Eggs too.

title: Charlie's Turtle Sauce Piquant
author: Charlie R. Marcantel
ingredients:
4 pounds Turtle Meat
1 Large head of Onion (chopped)
1 Cup chopped Parsley (loose not packed)
1-1/2 Cup chopped Onion Tops (not packed)
8 ounces Tomato Sauce (small can)
If you don't like parsley, skimp on the parsley
instructions:
Cover bottom of heavy pot with cooking oil
Put in turtle meat and fry it till brown, then....
Add chopped head of onion, chopped green onion tops and parsley, and let this fry until chopped head of onion turns clear, then....
Add tomato sauce and enough water to just cover the meat. 
Bring to a low boil (simmering) and at this time, also Add black pepper, red pepper, and salt, Season to suite your taste.
Cook for 55 minutes.
misc: We Cajuns serve it over rice. It also tastes good with bread. About the only thing we Cajuns don't eat with rice is toast bread.

title: Blanc's Fish Couveion (Sauce)
author: Wedney 'Blanc' Guillory
ingredients:
3 pounds of dressed Catfish
1 Tablespoon Crisco Shortening
2 Tablespoons all purpose white Flour
1 teaspoon Salt
3/4 teaspoon Red Pepper
1 Cup Onion Head (chopped)
1/2 Cup Parsley (chopped)
1 Cup chopped Green Onions
1/4 Cup Bell Pepper (chopped)
4 ounces Tomato Sauce
instructions:
Use 4 quart pot. 
Smear shortening in bottom of pot then add onions, green onions, parsley, bell Pepper, tomato sauce, and white flour. then
Add 1 Cup Water
Put on high heat for 5 minutes, or until mixture comes to a boil. Then cook on low/medium heat for 45 minutes. As ingredients cook, you should hear an occasional "plop, plop” sound coming from the cooking pot. That sound will let you know that the heat is about right.
Occasionally, stir very gently. Do not stir with a spoon as you would stir soup. If you do, the fish will come apart and your sauce will turn into a mush. It's best to stir very gently or shake the pot in a swishing circular motion, just enough to prevent fish from sticking to the bottom of pot.
misc: In Cajun Country we serve it over rice. Of course, it also tastes great with bread.

title: Juanita's Couveion (Sauce) for Fish, Crawfish, or Shrimp
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
3 Cups Water
1/2 Cup chopped Green Onions
1/2 Cup chopped Parsley
1 Medium Onion (chopped)
1 Medium Bell Pepper (chopped)
1 Tablespoon Cooking Oil
2 Tablespoons White Flour
1-1/4 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
1 teaspoon fresh Garlic or 1/2 teaspoon dried minced Garlic
6 oz. can of Tomato Sauce
1-1/4 teaspoon of Roux if using with Crawfish or Shrimp
instructions:
Use 4 quart size heavy sauce Pan.
Add: Oil, Onions, Bell Peppers, and Garlic.
Saute under medium heat until onions tum clear
Add tomato sauce and saute until sauce changes from its original bright red to an orange red.
Add Flour and stir until it is well mixed.
Add Water, Salt, Pepper, all seasonings and let simmer on low heat for about an hour...then
Add Green Onion Tops, Parsley, and Fish. 
Allow to simmer under low heat for another 20 minutes, so fish doesn't come apart.

To adapt sauce for Crawfish or Shrimp, add 1-1/4 teaspoon of Roux to sauce...and that's it.
misc:
|Jake: This is what Juanita uses for her Crawfish or Shrimp Etouffee.|
|Jake: Juanita gave me this tip to keep the roux from lumping up in the sauce. She said to mix the roux with some water in a separate bowl and microwave it.
Once the water is hot, you can use a spoon to break up the roux in the water until it mixes well. You can then add this mixture to the sauce.
Probably best to do this BEFORE you add the seafood to the sauce so you can cook the sauce down if it ends up too watery.|

title: Anita's Crawfish Bisque
author: Anita Fontenot of Mamou
ingredients:
[Ingredients for Stuffing]
1 lb. dressed Crawfish (ground)
1 Cup Italian seasoned bread crumbs
1/4 Cup Green Onion Tops (minced)
1/4 Cup Parsley (minced)
1/4 Cup Bell Pepper (chopped)
1 Large Head Onion (chopped fine)
1 Bud of Garlic (minced)
2 Stems Celery (chopped fine)
2 Eggs
Salt, Black Pepper, Red Pepper
30-40 Crawfish backs (ready for stuffing)
Flour

[Ingredients for Stew]
1 lb. dressed Crawfish Tails
1/2 can Tomato Paste (3 oz.)
3 Tablespoons salad oil
1/2 Onion (chopped fine)
2 Garlic Buds (minced fine)
1/2 Cup prepared Roux
Salt, Black Pepper, Red Pepper, and Water
instructions:
[Instructions for Stuffing]
Mix all the above ingredients (except eggs, crawfish backs and flour)
Stir in the eggs and season to taste with salt, black pepper and lots of Red Pepper.
Stuff backs with mixture, then coat backs in flour
Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees 

[Instructions for Stew]
In heavy pot: heat oil and saute Onion and Garlic. then
Add Tomato Paste and cook until dark.
Add roux and 2 cups water and cook until dissolved (stirring often) and season highly with Salt, Black and Red Pepper.
Add stuffed backs and enough water to cover backs and cook for about 45 minutes. then
Add Crawfish tails and cook 20 more minutes. Serve over rice.
misc: Anita's recipe won the 1996 FNBC Recipe Contest (First National Bank of Commerce of New Orleans)

title: Stephanie's Crawfish Balls
author: Stephanie Dupre of Ville Platte
ingredients:
2 pounds of peeled Crawfish Tails
1 chopped Head of Onion
1 chopped Bell Pepper
1 Egg (beaten)
4 Slices of stale Bread
3 Tablespoons of chopped Parsley
3 Tablespoons of chopped Green Onion Tops
Salt, Black Pepper, and Red Pepper to taste.
1-1/2 Cup Bread Crumbs
instructions:
Grind Crawfish Tails, Onions, Bell Pepper, and slices of bread in a food processor or grinder.
Add Egg, Parsley, Onion Tops, seasoning (to taste),and Mix thoroughly.
Shape into Balls about the size of Walnuts and Roll in Bread Crumbs.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
misc: After rolling in bread crumbs, they can be frozen and later baked without thawing.

title: Juanita's Southern Fried Chicken
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
[Ingredients for Seasoning Fryer]
1 Fryer 3-1/2 to 4 1b. (cut up)
1-1/2 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
1/4 teaspoon Black Pepper
1 teaspoon "French" Mustard
1/2 teaspoon Garlic Salt
Mix the above ingredients together and use to season the Fryer. Rub it on the individual pieces.

[Ingredients for Coating Fryer]
1 Cup All Purpose Flour
1 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
Mix these ingredients together
instructions:
Wash Fryer, cut up and pat dry with towels
Rub seasoning on individual pieces of the Fryer
Roll seasoned pieces in Flour mixture to coat. Drop coated pieces into deep fat fryer.
Fry smaller pieces about 12 minutes
Fry drum sticks and thighs about 15 minutes
Remove from hot oil and put to drain on paper towels.

title: Juanita's Filet Mignon Rolled Steak
author: Juanita Ardoin of Mamou, La.
ingredients:
1 Round Steak -- about 1/4 inch in thickness.
1/2 lb. sliced Bacon
1/2 medium head of Onion--sliced real thin and sliced lengthwise.
1/2 Bell Pepper--sliced real thin and lengthwise.
1 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
2 Tablespoons of cooking oil
instructions:
Place steak on flat surface and season with salt and pepper--rub it in.
Spread onion and bell pepper slices the length of the steak.
Place slices of bacon on top of onion and bell pepper slices.
Roll steak and tie with string or use toothpicks.
Put steak in pot with 2 tablespoons of oil and 1/4 cup of water.
Cook on Hi-heat until brown. When water runs out, let it brown well--then add another 1/4 cup of water before turning steak to another uncooked section.
Repeat process until all sides are browned.
Then, Add 1-1/2 cup of water and let simmer on low for 45-minutes.

title: Alice Foster's Crabmeat Rockafellow
author: Alice Foster, First Lady of Louisiana 1996-2004
ingredients:
2 lbs. lump Crabmeat
2 pkgs. frozen Spinach (10 oz. box)
1/2 Cup Italian Bread Crumbs
1 Cup Mayonnaise
1 teaspoon Mustard
2 teaspoons grated Onion
2 teaspoons Lemon Juice
Red Pepper (to taste)
1 Cup grated Sharp Cheese
8 Ramekins
instructions:
Cook the spinach per package directions
Drain well and add bread crumbs
Set mixture asideIn another bowl, mix mayonnaise, mustard, red pepper, lemon juice, and onion to make the sauce
In each ramekin, layer first the spinach and breadcrumb mixture, then
Top with Crabmeat, then
Add the sauce and finally the grated Cheese
Pre-Heat oven to 350 degrees and bake at 350degrees until the cheese melts.
misc: Shrimp may be substituted for crabmeat

title: Governor Mike Foster's Deviled Oysters
author: Mike Foster, Govenor of Louisiana 1996-2004
ingredients:
1/2 Cup Butter
1 Cup finely chopped Celery
1 Cup finely chopped Green Onions and Tops
1 Cup finely chopped Head of Onion
3 dozen Oysters, drained
1/4 Cup chopped Parsley
4 slices stale bread--moistened with evaporated milk
2 Cloves Garlic, chopped
3 Tablespoons Worchestershire Sauce
1 teaspoon Tabasco Sauce (or to taste)
Salt and Pepper to taste
Baking Shells (optional)
instructions:
Saute Celery and Onions in Butter until soft
Add Oysters, Parsley, moistened bread andremaining ingredients.
Cook on low fire until moist, not soupy
Pour the mixture into individual baking shells or a 9x9-inch casserole dish. then
Sprinkle with seasoned bread crumbs and dot with Butter.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and bake until browned, about 20 minutes.

title: Governor Mike Foster's Tomato Dressing
author: Mike Foster, Govenor of Louisiana 1996-2004
ingredients:
1 lb. lean Beef 
12 links breakfast Pork Sausages
1 can Rotel Tomatoes
1 can Tomato Sauce
2 cans stewed tomatoes (chopped well)
2 large Onions
1 Green Pepper
3 Cloves Garlic 
1 teaspoon Sugar
Thyme (to taste)
Oregano (to taste)
Black Pepper (to taste)
Dash of Cinnamon
1 large can Italian bread crumbs (Set aside 1/4 Cup for later use)
Butter
instructions:
Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees. Cut Sausages into bite size pieces.
Brown Sausage and beef together in a skillet.
Remove meat from the skillet and set aside.
In the remaining drippings (in the same skillet), Saute Onions, Green Pepper and Garlic.
Return meat to the skillet.
Add Rotel tomatoes, tomato sauce and stewed tomatoes.
Add black pepper, oregano, thyme, cinnamon, and sugar.
Cook covered for 1/2 hour.
Add Italian bread crumbs (less 1/4 cup).
Pour into casserole dish--Top with 1/4 cup of the remaining bread crumbs and dot with butter.
Bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.

title: Jimmy C. Newman's 'Cajun Rice Dressing'
author: Jimmy C. Newman of Christiana, Tennessee
ingredients:
6 Pork Chops
1/4 pound Fresh Liver
1 Large Onion (chopped)
1 Cup Dried Bell Pepper
6 Cups Cooked Rice
1 Cup Green Onions, diced
Salt, Black Pepper and Red Pepper (to taste)
instructions:
Put pork chops, liver, onion and bell pepper in pot
Season with Salt and Pepper to taste and cover completely with water.
Cook over low heat for 1 hour and let it cookdown until brown. (Check bottom of the pot frequently for sticking.)
Add more water (about 1-1/2 cups) and simmer for 15 minutes.
Take meats out of liquid and de-bone pork chops |Jake: you need to save the liquid at this step, some will be used later|
Grind or mince the meat and liver to a coarse texture.
Put the ground meat in a large bowl and ADD Cooked Rice to the meat mixture, and ADD Green Onions and Parsley.
Now Add the liquid to your mixture (not too much)
Cover bowl (to keep warm) and let sit for 25 or 30 minutes.
Serve Hot!

title: Verline's Sweet Potato Filling
author: Verline Fontenot
ingredients:
2 Cups mashed sweet potatoes (cooked) or 1 lb. can of sweet potatoes.
1/2 Cup brown sugar (packed)
3 Tablespoons of flour
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon ginger
2 Eggs, slightly beaten
1/2 Cup fresh Cream or evaporated milk
1 unbaked pastry shell
instructions:
Place sugar, flour, salt, and spices in large bowl.
Add sweet potatoes and stir until smooth. then....
Add slightly beaten egg into mixture, along with cream.
Pour mixture into pie shell.
Bake at 375°F degrees until knife inserted just off center comes out clean. About 50 to 55 minutes.

title: Dr. Brent Ardoin's Sausage & Tasso Brown Gravy
author: Dr. Brent C. Ardoin
ingredients:
1 lb. Sausage
1/2 lb. Tasso
1 Tablespoon Cooking Oil
1/2 Cup Water
1 Medium head of Onion (chopped)
No other seasoning required as it is in the Sausage and on the Tasso
instructions:
Put Water & Cooking Oil in Pot on High Heat
Add Tasso and Sausage and Boil until water boils out. Cook until meat is Very Brown.....then
Add 1/4 Cup Water; then turn meat to brown on another side.
Repeat the process until all sides are very brown.
After water has boiled out for the last time, lower heat to Medium High and ADD chopped Onions and let saute until light brown....then
Add 1-1/2 Cup Water and simmer on low heat for 35 minutes or until done.
Leave gravy just to cover meat and serve over rice.
misc: |Jake: This makes the assumption that the sausage and tasso are being bought somewhere where they season such things well. Otherwise, you may want to add some salt, pepper, and red pepper to taste.|

title: Tante Sue's Tasso Meat Balls
author: Tante Sue de Mamou -- Manager of Fred's Lounge
ingredients:
2 pounds Ground Pork Tasso
1 pound Ground Pork Meat
3 pounds Ground Beef Meat
2 head Onion (food processor or chopped very fine)
3 Eggs
1 Cup Green Onion Tops (chopped)
1/2 Cup Parsley (chopped)
7.5 ounce can Jalapeno Relish
Bread Crumbs
instructions:
Mix all the ingredients with the 3 kinds ofground meat.
Add Bread Crumbs as needed to make meat balls that hold together.
Cook over stove or Bake in oven, as you would cook any other meat balls.
serving_size: approximately 90 to 100 small bite size meat balls.
misc:
I make small bite size meat balls. This is very good for parties, weddings, showers, etc.
|Jake: presumably a quote from Tante Sue|

title: Juanita's Cajun Boucherie Liver
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1 pound of Beef Liver (ground up)
1 pound Beef Meat (ground up)
1 Medium Head of Onion (chopped fine)
1 Medium Bell Pepper (chopped fine)
2 Tablespoons Cooking Oil
1-1/2 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
2 Tablespoons of Flour
1 Can Tomato Sauce (8 oz.)
1/2 Cup Water
instructions:
Combine: Oil, Liver, and Meat
Add Seasoning
Cook at Medium Heat for 6 minutes (until light brown in color)
Add Tomato Sauce, stir well and cook for 5 more minutes.
Add Flour and Mix Well.... then
Add Water and let Simmer on Low Heat for 15 more minutes.
Serve over Rice, French Bread or on a slice of bread.

title: Baked Duck a la Edwin
author: By Governor Edwin W. Edwards — 4-term Governor
ingredients:
6 Large ducks (cleaned and leave damp) rub salt and pepper or favorite seasoning (Tony Chachere, etc.) in cavity and exterior of ducks.
6 medium red apples
1 stalk celery
6 medium yellow onions
1 cup red wine
2 12-oz. cans chicken stock
instructions:
Cut apples, celery and onions into large pieces and mix.
Stuff cavity of ducks with apples, celery and onion mixture.
Place ducks in uncovered roasting pan, breast down.
Place remaining apples, celery and onion mixture over and around ducks.
Mix 1/2 cup red wine and one (1) 12 oz. can of chicken stock and pour over ducks.
Fill pan with water until ducks are 1/2 submerged in liquid.
Place in oven at 400 degrees and allow to simmer approximately 1-1/2 hours or until 1/2 of liquid has evaporated.
Turn ducks and add remaining wine and chicken stock.
Cook until tender, approximately 1-1/2 hours. Add additional water if needed

title: Juanita's Cajun Sauce Piquant
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
2 Ibs. lean boneless Stew Meat (beef or pork) Dice to about 1-inch pieces
1 lb. smoked sausage. Cut sausages in lengths of about 1-1/2 inches.
1 lb. Tasso (smoked meat). If Tasso not available, use a pound of other meat—chicken gizzards, etc.
4 Tablespoons of Bacon fat or cooking oil.
4 Cups Water
2 Large onions(chopped)
2 large Bell Peppers (chopped)
Roux
Red Pepper
Black Pepper
Mustard
Garlic
Salt
Sugar
8 oz. can of tomato sauce
white flour
instructions:
Put bacon grease in heavy aluminum or cast ironpot then: Brown Meat Well.
After meat is browned, add chopped onions, chopped bell peppers, and 3 teaspoons of minced garlic.
Saute until onions are clear; Add (while stirring) 8 oz.can of (Hunts) tomato sauce, and stir until tomatoes turn a darker shade of red.... then
Add 2 Tablespoons of Mustard and 4 Tablespoons of white flour and mix well....then
Add 2 teaspoons Sugar and 2 teaspoons of Roux
Add 4 cups of water and Stir well... then
Add 2 teaspoons Salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper
Bring to a boil and let simmer for about 1-1/2 hours on low-Heat, stirring every 15 minutes, so it won't stick to bottom of pot.
misc: Recipe works for rabbit, squirrel, deer, ducks, birds,turtle, alligator & etc. Cajuns serve it over rice.

title: Juanita's Cajun Smothered Beef Cutlets
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1-1/2 to 2 lb. Round Steak (tenderized)
3 Tablespoons Oil
1/4 Cup Milk
1/4 Cup Flour
1/2 teaspoon Garlic (minced)
1/2 medium Onion (chopped)
1/2 Bell Pepper (chopped)
1 Tablespoon Mustard
1-1/4 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
1/4 teaspoon Black Pepper
3 Tablespoons Milk
instructions:
Cut Steak in serving size pieces
Put in a bowl. Add 1/4 cup milk and let soak 30 minutes, then season and roll in 1/4 cup flour.
Put 3 Tablespoons oil in heavy skillet and heat. Brown pieces of meat on both sides.... then
Remove meat from skillet & set aside for a while
Add onions, bell pepper and garlic to skillet and saute until onions clear. 
Keep scraping the bottom of pot where flour stuck while frying meat, After saute is done....then
Add meat back into pot -- and Add 1 Tablespoon flour, 3 Tablespoon Milk, and 1 Tablespoon mustard. Stir well; add 1 cup water and stir well again
Simmer on low for 45 minutes. (May require more water as time goes by....cooking time)

title: Juanita's Beef Tongue
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
[Ingredients]
Tongue must first be heavily scraped and then cleaned with a stiff brush
2 Tablespoons Cooking Oil
1 large clove of garlic (minced) or 1/2 teaspoon of dried minced garlic
3 Tablespoons of mixed onion and bell pepper. (I chop up 1/2 head of onion and 1/2 bell pepper and mix them.)
1/2 teaspoon of Salt
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
instructions:
[Instructions for Stuffing]
Mix together garlic, onion, bell pepper, salt, black pepper, and red pepper.

[Instructions for Tongue]
On the underside of the tongue, cut a deep gash the length of the tongue (except ends). Make the cut as deep as possible, without cutting through the top part of the tongue. This forms a pocket into which the stuffing will be inserted.
Fill the pocket with stuffing and sew (stitch) it up.
Put tongue in heavy pot with 1/2 cup of water and 2 Tablespoons of Cooking Oil.
Let boil until water boils out and fry tongue until it browns.... then
Add 2 more Tablespoons of Onion mixture andsaute until onions are clear.... then
Add 1 cup of water and let simmer on low for 1 hour. Add more water as you cook--if needed."
misc: This makes the finest brown gravy you ever laideyes on. A feast for Royalty.

title: Juanita's Smothered Beef Liver
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1 lb. Beef Liver--sliced about 1/2 inch in thickness.
2 Tablespoons of cooking oil
1/4 head of Onion (chopped)
1/4 Bell Pepper (chopped)
1 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper (cayenne)
1/4 teaspoon Black Pepper
instructions:
Season liver with salt & pepper (black & red)
Heat oil in heavy skillet
Brown liver well (until good and brown) on both sides (under low heat)
Add onions and bell pepper and saute untilonions are clear... then
Add 1/2 cup of water and let simmer for 15 minutes.
We Cajuns serve it over rice.
misc: It can't be beat. It makes a thick dark brown gravy that is simply delicious. Liver never tasted so good.

title: Juanita's Round Steak Cajun Style
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1 Round Steak (1/2 inch thick). Cut steak into 2-inch squares....after you season it.
2 Tablespoons Canola cooking oil
1 medium head of Onion (sliced or chopped)
1 medium Bell Pepper (sliced or chopped)
1 clove of Garlic or 1/4 teaspoon dry Garlic
1/2 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper (Cayenne)
2 Cups Water
instructions:
sPut 2 Tablespoons cooking oil in heavy pot
Add 1/4 Cup Water
Season steak and cut in pieces. Put in pot with oil and water.
Cook on High heat until water evaporates and then let meat fry until dark brown.....then Add 1/4 cup of water.
Flip the meat over and repeat the cooking process (but do not add water just yet).
Add Onions, bell pepper, and garlic and saute until onions/etc. are soft...then
Add 1-1/2 cups water and let simmer on low heat for 45 minutes.

title: Juanita's Breaded Pork Chops
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
6 Pork Chops (1/2 inch thick)
1/2 Cup Evaporated Milk
3/4 Cup Flour -- Seasoned with 1 teaspoon Salt and 1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
You'll need another teaspoon of Salt and another 1/2 teaspoon of red pepper to season the chops.
instructions:
Place Pork Chops and Milk in a bowl, coating chops well.
Let stand (soak) in the milk for 30-minutes, then season chops with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of red pepper.
As you're ready to cook them, take the 3/4 cup of flour and coat each pork chop.
Place in hot oil and fry for 10-minutes.
misc: To make it seem as if you worked hard, sprinkle a little of the left-over flour on your apron, your face and hands--that ought to convince them that cooking is hard work.

title: Juanita's Rolled Steak
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1 Round Steak -- sliced 1/4 inch thick
1 lb. Ground meat--half beef & half pork (50-50) (if you wish, you can use all beef or all pork.)
1/4 medium Onion
1/4 Bell Pepper
1/4 Cup chopped Parsley
1/4 Cup chopped Green Onion Tops
1/2 teaspoon Salt
1/4 teaspoon Black Pepper
1/4 teaspoon Red Pepper
instructions:
Put round steak flat on a board and season with 1/4 teaspoon Salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and1/4 teaspoon Red Pepper.
Put ground meat in a bowl and mix with onions, bell pepper, parsley, green onion tops, and season to your taste.
Spread ground meat mix on steak and roll it up. Tie with string or anchor with toothpicks.
Put 2 Tablespoons of oil and 1/4 cup of water in heavy pot and put steak in pot.
Cook on Hi-Heat until brown--when water runs out, let it brown well before adding another 1/4 cup of water--then turn steak to another uncooked side.
Repeat process until all sides of steak are browned
Then Add 1-1/2 cup of water and let simmer for 45-minutes.

title: Mayor Joubert's Recipe for Roux
author: Mayor Curtis Joubert of Eunice, La.
ingredients:
1 Cup Flour
1 Cup Cooking Oil
instructions:
[Instructions for Roux on Stove]
In heavy skillet Put 1 cup oil and 1 cup of flour
Cook over medium Heat and stir constantly
When rich golden color is reached-Roux is done.
Put Roux in another dish to stop cooking process
If Roux is left in a hot pot, it will continue cookingand get too dark.

[Instructions for Roux in Microwave]
Tn Microwave Container: Put 1 Cup Flour and 1 Cup Cooking Oil
Stir until well blended together....then
Cook for 4 minutes
Then stir and cook in 3 minute intervals until rich golden brown color is reached.
Put Roux in another dish to stop cooking process. If Roux is left in a hot pot, it will continue cooking and get too dark.

title: Mayor Joubert's Chicken Gumbo
author: Mayor Curtis J. Joubert, former mayor of Eunice
ingredients:
1 Fryer (or Hen) cut up (seafood or other meats can be substituted)
3 quarts of water
2 large Onion heads (chopped)
20 Green Onion Tops (chopped)
3/4. Pint Roux
1 lb. smoked sausage (pork or mixed--pork and beef) cut up into bite size portions. If not available, add more chicken, seafood or whatever.
instructions:
Bring 3 quarts of seasoned water to a boil
Add chicken and sausage
Cook for 1 hour and 15 minutes on medium heat
Add onion tops 5 minutes before turning off heat.
The color of gumbo is dependent on the amount of roux added.
misc:
This is a simple gumbo recipe. Many variations for gumbo exist, which allow adding other ingredients such as garlic, bell pepper, shrimp, and etc.

Curtis J. Joubert:
This recipe was presented to a packed house of English people who had never heard of gumbo. This took place in London, England in the Queen Elizabeth Hall, when we brought the famous Cajun Show "Rendez Vous Des Cajun” to England, The Queen's loyal subjectsloved the music and the show; and I hope they tried the gumbo recipe.

|Jake: At first I thought this recipe forgot to include seasoning, but it looks like the term 'seasoned water' in the first line of the instructions implies this should be seasoned to taste. Salt, black pepper, and red pepper would be a good start.|

title: Juanita's Cajun Gumbo
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
12 Cups Water
1 Hen (cut in pieces)
1 medium head of onion (chopped1)
1 medium bell pepper (chopped)
2/3 Cup Roux
4 Tablespoons Green Onion tops (chopped)
4 Tablespoons Parsley (chopped)
1-1/2 Tablespoons Salt
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper (or to taste)
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper (or to taste)
instructions:
Put 12 Cups of water in a heavy pot.
Add chopped onions; chopped bell pepper and 2/3 cup of roux. |See note about roux in miscellaneous section.|
Boil for 15 minutes.... then
Add pieces of hen, Green Onion Tops, Parsley, Salt, black pepper, red pepper, and boil for 45-minutes to 1 hour (until meat is tender).
Gumbo is eaten with rice.
misc:
If you Add sausage, add sausage with hen.
Before serving, skim the oil off the top.
My family loves boiled eggs with their gumbo. Boil eggs before hand. Peel and drop them in with hen. 
We Cajuns usually add about 6 to 10 drops of hot vinegar to our individual serving of gumbo. What we call hot vinegar is vinegar in which Jalapeno peppers have been steeped.
|Jake: People who haven't eaten this before may not know the consitency of gumbo to look for. It's somewhere in between soup and stew. It's not thick like a stew, but it's not thin like a soup. It's a little thicker than a soup.|
|Jake: If it's too thin, you can add more roux. If it's too thick, you can add more water. You should add the roux as described below to keep clumps of it from sticking to the ingredients in the pot|
|Jake: Roux likes to stick to stuff. You can avoid this by mixing the roux and water before you add anything else. Or, if you need to add roux later, you do this: add roux and some water in a seperate bowl. Microwave until water is hot then mash the roux with a spoon and mix until it blends with water. Keep on microwaving it if you are having trouble getting it to mix. Then pour the water into the gumbo to add the roux. The excess water can be boiled off until its the right consitency.|

title: Juanita's Roux
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1 Cup Flour
1 Cup Cooking Oil
instructions:
Mix together the above ingredients and brown slowly on top of stove, stirring often until it turns rusty-brown in color.
Then transfer to a cool dish to stop the cooking process. If left in the pot the roux will continue cooking and will get too dark.
After the roux has cooled, drain off the excess oil. The Roux is ready. But, don't throw the oil you drained off--you will need to put back the oil when you store the roux that may be left over. Roux will keep in refrigerator for several weeks, if stored in a covered mason jar. You should pour the oil you drained off--pour on top of roux in jar--to prevent drying out.

title: Juanita's Okra Gumbo
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
1 lb. fresh Okra (sliced 1/8 inch thick)
2 Tablespoons cooking oil.
1/2 lb. smoked sausage (cut in 1/4 inch slices)
1/2 lb. Tasso (smoked meat) sliced in 1/4 inch pieces.
1/2 Cup Tomato Sauce
1/2 Cup canned tomatoes (smashed)
1/2 head of medium Onion (chopped)
1/2 medium Bell Pepper (chopped)
1 Tablespoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper
1/2 teaspoon Red Pepper
2 Tablespoons Roux
5 Cups Water
instructions:
Put Cooking Oil in heavy pot and fry Okra until it does not slime anymore....then
Add all other ingredients....and
Cook for 45 minutes at medium heat

title: Emelie's Rabbit--Turnip Stew
author: Emelie Frazer -- won 1997 award 'Woman of the Year'
ingredients:
1 Rabbit (cut up)
2 Large head of Onions (chopped)
1 level Tablespoon of Flour
4 Tablespoons Cooking Oil
3 or 4 Tumips
3 or 4 Carrots (optional)
2 Tablespoons Parsley
2 Tablespoons Green Onion Tops
Salt, Black Pepper, and Red Pepper to taste.
instructions:
Put oil in pot. There should be enough to cover bottom of your pot.
Add Flour and make a Roux with the flour...then
Add Rabbit and chopped Onion head
Cook over a low fire, adding a little water at a time. Keep pot covered.
When Rabbit begins to get tender, Add Turnips and Carrots.
Let cook until about done, then Add Parsley and Green Onion Tops.
Serve over Rice
misc: Emelie's recipe from her mother, Mrs. Edna Breaux

title: Juanita's Old Fashioned Stew
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
2-1/2 lb. Ground Meat or Chicken
3/4 Cup of Roux 
1 medium head of Onion (chopped)
1 medium Bell Pepper (chopped)
1 teaspoon Minced Garlic
2 Tablespoons Green Onion Tops (chopped)
2 Tablespoons of Parsley (chopped)
2 Tablespoons Salt
1 teaspoon Black Pepper
1 teaspoon Red Pepper
4 Cups Water
3 medium Irish Potatoes (cut potatoes in half andthen cut halves in half, so they'll cook tender.)
instructions:
Mix chopped onions & chopped bell pepper together.
Add 2 Tablespoons of this mixture to ground meat and Add 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon red pepper, and one slice of bread soaked in 1 Tablespoon of Milk. Mix all this together and form meat balls.
In a heavy pot, place 5 cups water and Add 3/4 cup of roux and bring to a boil until roux dissolves.
Add 1 teaspoon minced Garlic
Add raw meat balls to pot & Cook 30 minutes....then
Add the 3 (cut up) medium Irish potatoes and
Add 2 Tablespoons of Green Onion tops and2 Tablespoons of chopped Parsley.
Cook for 30 more minutes on medium heat.

title: To Cook Rice the Cajun Way
author: Juanita Ardoin
ingredients:
To cook short or medium grain rice use the following proportions: 1 cup water to 1 cup rice.
Long grain rice: 1-1/2 cups water to 1 cup rice.
Salt the water to taste. We usually salt it after adding water to the rice. We now use electric rice cookers.
instructions:
[Instructions for cooking rice on Stove]
Use the above proportions in a pot. Heat on thestove until the water comes to a boil; then put lid on pot and lower heat until it simmers or just slightly boils--then put lid back on the pot.
If this is your first time, you should peep under the cover about every 4 minutes, as you need to know when water dissipates.
Let this go on until the water stops making bubbles on top of the rice. (The air bubbles thatform will now be very big and have theappearance of starchy bubbles).
Lower wick to very low heat and lit cook forabout 20 minutes. Then...turn off the heat and let it set about 12 minutes before serving.
misc:
Never stir the rice at any time during the entire Process. If you do, rice will be mushy or gooey.
If at first you don't succeed, try again. It really isn't difficult. Pretty soon you won't peek but once or twice.
